General Lefort (as they have asseverated) left nothing to excite the envy of his people against him- self or his heirs. Nay, his kinsman prostrate upon the ground before Prince Galizin‚ protested that he had not the means of buying the usual mourning suit for himself.

fflst March, 1699.— As all the representatives were invited to the funeral of the late General Lefort, they all appeared in mourning. Eight in the morn- ing was the hour appointed for carrying out the body. But before everybody had arrived and every- thing was ready, the sun that looked down on the sad scene had risen nearly to the meridian. Mean- time‚ after the manner of the Slowoda folk‚ the tables were laid out, groaning under viands, and drinking cups in long array, and bowls mantling with every description of wine. Mulled wine was served to those who preferred it.
